column1: The Investing in VETS Act solves the discrepancy between federal contracting goals for service-disabled veteran-owned small businesses & other small business contracting categories something that was brought to my attention during a constituent meeting w Eric from Jeffersonville https://t.co/wttgjH4t3J

Today and every day we give thanks to those who have served our country.  This year on Veterans Day I am honoring our country’s veterans by introducing the Investing in Veteran Entrepreneurial Talents (VETs) Act. https://t.co/57zLJLhpSJ #VeteransDay https://t.co/AZy7etXqef

By the numbers our Hoosier manufacturers:  ➡️ Employ almost 20% of Indiana’s workforce. ➡️ Account for almost 30% of Indiana’s economic output. ➡️ Export $21.6 billion to free trade partners around the globe.  #MFGDay20 https://t.co/3QzgiUsVcF
Today is #NationalManufacturingDay a day to recognize the ingenuity and perseverance of American manufacturing and all it contributes to our country and economy. #MFGDay20 https://t.co/POF5FBaj2p

At a farm roundtable in Washington County a farmer shared his stories of costly black vulture attacks and his inability to protect his livestock because of the federal bureaucracy. We turned this into meaningful action for farmers across the country. https://t.co/HQaDG9wRpE

Passed the House → the Livestock Protection Act which would fix the federal bureaucracy and allow Hoosiers to protect their livestock from predatory black vultures has passed the House and the Senate soon to be signed by the President. https://t.co/NW1cFC1Er9

My statement on why I voted ‘yes’ to table H. Res. 1148 a resolution on statues in the U.S. Capitol that doesn’t help American families and businesses move forward and bounce back from this pandemic: https://t.co/MEL650lu1k

That’s why I’ve continued pushing for passage of my DRIVE-Safe Act legislation to open up more driving industry jobs to Hoosiers at a time when we all want to see higher employment and wages → https://t.co/Lv4O1rWtkj #NTDAW2020 https://t.co/QjcO27R17v
Trucking is essential to our nation’s economy: getting products on our retailer’s shelves + directly into customers’ hands.

Over the past few months truck drivers played a key role in delivering essential products like toilet paper hand sanitizer and face masks so we could stay safe throughout the pandemic. Thank you to all truck drivers for your tireless work. #NTDAW2020 https://t.co/ox6Cw0z4QM

This week is #NationalTruckDriverAppreciationWeek. We’ve always relied on our truck drivers for timely and efficient deliveries to our homes our businesses and our local shops and restaurants. #NTDAW2020

Our casework team was able to help Chris file his claim and receive the benefits he was due. We’re here to help you navigate the red tape of the federal bureaucracy and ensure that our government is working for you. Read the full story in Chris’s words: https://t.co/bYtPVwA3DA https://t.co/3EvQO1QWFZ

Meet Chris → a U.S. Army veteran from Nashville IN. While filing a claim with the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Chris ran into bureaucratic delays and was having trouble making any headway with the federal government. https://t.co/HMXRY4euBr

These words from @GWBLibrary still ring true 19 years later. I remember exactly what I was doing on the morning of September 11 2001 and I’m sure you do too. It’s seared into our memories. Every year as we reflect on 9/11 we are reminded of how lucky we are to be Americans. https://t.co/WF9lACV849

“Terrorist attacks can shake the foundations of our biggest buildings but they cannot touch the foundation of America. These acts shatter steel but they cannot dent the steel of American resolve.” #September11

Our communities have done an incredible job helping Hoosiers get back on their feet after the COVID-19 shutdown. Now strengthening our local infrastructure is a key component of delivering jobs and economic development to Indiana https://t.co/GAk46nxDND https://t.co/bDsROJQ14U

Six municipal airports in French Lick Paoli Seymour Salem Bloomington and Bedford just received part of the U.S. Department of Transportation’s investment in airport safety and infrastructure grants. https://t.co/wIp0fJqgLW

USPS: We have lost $78 billion in twelve years. Mail volumes are down to 1985 levels but addresses are at an all time high. 23% fewer people are coming into the post office to buy things but post office locations are only down 4%.

Our small businesses up and down #IN09 are home to some of the hardest working people I’ve met. They’re providing for their families employees communities and the future of our Hoosier economy. I will continue to fight for Hoosier small businesses every day in Congress. https://t.co/GlYQR9UGJQ

I’m excited to see that thru the CARES Act schools can apply for funds to provide students w/ laptops or hotspots so all can succeed while distance learning. We have a long way to go to solve this problem but this is a great step in the right direction: https://t.co/RoLqBL0PpH
At home learning during coronavirus highlighted this lack of access to reliable internet for many families who now need it to access the classroom.

Disparity in access to reliable internet has always been a reality in Indiana. I’ve met with members of the Indiana Electric Cooperatives numerous times to discuss this issue + how to help all Hoosiers especially students access the internet and technology they need to succeed.

To thank some of these incredible and hardworking Hoosiers for their time dedication expertise and bravery I spent yesterday afternoon delivering lunch to emergency rooms and police offices in Floyd and Harrison Counties:
Many worked countless hours and days on the frontlines to ensure we had the health and safety measures necessary throughout each phase of the pandemic.
For the past few months our communities have been all hands on deck to help others through the health risks and uncertainty posed by the coronavirus pandemic.

Congratulations Naomi C. from Bloomington High School for winning the 2020 Congressional Art Competition with her piece “Carry-Out Only” which will hang in the U.S. Capitol for the next year. Congrats Naomi and thank you to all who participated! https://t.co/EGR0dpwIsN

I hear from Hoosiers every day who are worried about feeding their families and saving their jobs. We have to recognize and have a conversation about the real economic cost of coronavirus and find a way to minimize both the economic costs and biological risks at the same time → https://t.co/eck46V44bx

Sheltering in place forever is not a sustainable strategy. It was a strategy meant to buy time. It was a strategy meant to flatten the curve. But it’s not a strategy that we can sit at home and wait for the coronavirus to pass. → https://t.co/UlCKg7D7ql

We owe Americans a reasonable thoughtful plan based in science to balance the health risks of coronavirus with the economic losses of people’s jobs and businesses and ability to support their children and go to church. As a country we need a way forward. https://t.co/lKbXvm6im9
